exclusion:
To remove the device from the Z-Wave network:

  1. Power the device.
  2. Set the main controller into remove mode (see the controller’s manual).
  3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  4. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.
  5. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.
inclusion:
To add the device to the Z-Wave network manually:

  1. Power the device.
  2. Set the main controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
  3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  4. If you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, scan the DSK QR code or input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).
  5. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.

Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:

  • Green - successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),
  • Magenta - successful (Security S2 Authenticated),
  • Red – not successful.

To add the device to the Z-Wave network using SmartStart:

  1. Set the main controller in Security S2 Authenticated add mode (see the controller’s manual). 
  2. Scan the DSK QR code or input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).
  3. Power the device.
  4. Wait for the adding process to start (up to few minutes), which is signaled with yellow LED blinking.

Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:

  •  Green - successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),
  • Magenta - successful (Security S2 Authenticated),
  • Red – not successful.
label: FGWDS
overview:
FIBARO Walli Single Switch is a smart wall switch designed to control one light sources via Z-Wave network. It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load. You can install it with provided cover plate or other compatible. 
Main features of FIBARO Walli Single Switch: 

  •  Can be used with: 
    • Conventional incandescent and halogen light sources, 
    •  LED lamps, 
    • Fluorescent lamps, 
    • Electronic transformers (for ELV halogen lamps and LED bulbs), 
    • Ferromagnetic transformers (for MLV halogen lamps). 
  • Can be used with provided cover plate or one of the following: 
    • GIRA – System 55 (Standard 55, E2, Event, Event Clear), 
    • Legrand – Céliane, 
    • Schneider – Odace. 
  • Active power and energy consumption metering. 
  • Supports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 encryption and S2 Authenticated with PRNG-based encryption. 
  • Works as Z-Wave signal repeater (all non-battery operated devices within the network will act as repeaters to increase reliability of the network). 
  • May be used with all devices certified with the Z-Wave Plus certificate and should be compatible with such devices produced by other manufacturers.
usage:
Factory reset:

Reset procedure allows to restore the device back to its factory settings, which means all information about the Z-Wave controller and user configuration will be deleted. Resetting to factory defaults does not reset energy consumption memory.

  1. Quickly, three times click, then press and hold one of the buttons to enter the menu.
  2. Release the button when the device glows yellow.
  3. Quickly click the button to confirm.
  4. After a few seconds the device will be restarted, which is signalled with the red LED colour.
wakeup: FIBARO Walli Double Switch is powered using DC power supply unit so it is always awake.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame color ON-state
channels.overview:
This channel allows to change the color for the LED ring of the frame when the switch is in ON.

The color can be assigned as follows
0 – LED disabled
1 – White
2 – Red
3 – Green
4 – Blue
5 – Yellow
6 – Cyan
7 – Magenta
8 – colour changes smoothly depending on measured power
9 – colour changes in steps depending on measured power

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame color OFF-state
channels.overview:
This channel allows to change the color for the LED ring of the frame when the switch is in OFF.

The color can be assigned as follows
0 – LED disabled
1 – White
2 – Red
3 – Green
4 – Blue
5 – Yellow
6 – Cyan
7 – Magenta

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame color brightness
channels.overview:
0: LED disabled
1 - 100: 1-100% brightness
101: brightness directly proportional to measured power
102: brightness inversely proportional to measured power

parameters.label: First channel – overload safety switch
parameters.overview:
0 (default) function disabled
10 to 36200 (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: Second channel – overload safety switch
parameters.overview:
0 (default) function disabled
10 to 36200 (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: LED frame – power limit
parameters.overview: (50.0-3680.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when ON
parameters.overview:
0 LED disabled
1 (Default) White
2 Red
3 Green
4 Blue
5 Yellow
6 Cyan
7 Magenta
8 colour changes smoothly depending on measured power
9 colour changes in steps depending on measured power

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when OFF
parameters.overview:
0 (default) LED disabled
1 White
2 Red
3 Green
4 Blue
5 Yellow
6 Cyan
7 Magenta

parameters.label: LED frame – brightness
parameters.overview:
0 LED disable
1 to 100
(Default)		 (1-100% brightness)
101 brightness directly proportional to measured power
102 brightness inversely proportional to measured power

parameters.label: Buttons operation
parameters.overview:
1 (default) 1 st and 2nd button toggle the load
2 1st button turns the load ON, 2nd button turns the load OFF
3 device works in 2-way/3-way switch configuration

parameters.label: Buttons orientation
parameters.overview:
0 (default) default (1st button controls 1st channel, 2nd button controls 2nd channel)
1 reversed (1st button controls 2nd channel, 2nd button controls 1st channel)

parameters.label: Outputs orientation
parameters.overview:
0 (default) default (Q1 - 1st channel, Q2 - 2nd channel)
1 reversed (Q1 - 2nd channel, Q2 - 1st channel)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameters.overview:
1 to 0 [MSB] – Notification Type
  2 Notification Value
  3 Event/State Parameters
  4 [LSB] – action

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
parameters.overview:
1 [MSB] – Notification Type
2 Notification Value
3 Event/State Parameters
4 [LSB] – action

2 Notification Value
3 Event/State Parameters
4 [LSB] – action

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 4th slot
parameters.overview:

2 Notification Status
3 Event/State Parameters
4 [LSB] – action

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameters.overview:
1 [MSB] – Notification Type

3 Event/State Parameters

parameters.label: Alarm configuration – duration
parameters.overview:

1 to 32400
(Default)		 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration

parameters.label: First button – scenes sent
parameters.overview:
1 Key pressed 1 time
2 Key pressed 2 time
4 Key pressed 3 time
8 Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Second button – scenes sent
parameters.overview:
1 Key pressed 1 time
2 Key pressed 2 time
4 Key pressed 3 time
8 Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: chan1reactdelayedoff
parameters.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
0(default) cancel mode and set default state
1 no reaction - mode runs until it ends
2 reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: chan2reactdelayedoff
parameters.description: Second channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
0(default) cancel mode and set default state
1 no reaction - mode runs until it ends
2 reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: chan1timedelayedoff
parameters.description: First channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
0 0.1 second
1 to 32000
(Default)		 (1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter

parameters.label: chan2timedelayedoff
parameters.description: Second channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
0 0.1 second
1 to 32000
(Default)		 (1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: 1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

associations.label: 1st channel On/Off
associations.overview: 2nd association group – “On/Off (1)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: 1st channel dimmer
associations.overview: 3rd association group – “Dimmer (1)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).

associations.label: 2nd channel On/Off
associations.overview: 4th association group* – “On/Off (2)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: 2nd channel dimmer
associations.overview: 5th association group* – “Dimmer (2)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).
